Package de.oth.blocklib.helper

Class BlockPos

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.helper.Vector3i
de.oth.blocklib.helper.BlockPos
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class BlockPos
extends Vector3i
A pos(ition) of a block in the world. Although it is not immutable the methods provided by BlockPos itself do not change the original object but rather create new objects. BlockPos provides easy modification methods to alter positions in the world.
Author:
Florian Loher
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • BlockPos

      public BlockPos​(int x, int y, int z)
      Constructs a BlockPos from a x, y and z coordinates like Vector3i(int, int, int)
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate (positive -> West, negative -> East)
      y - The y coordinate (positive -> Up, negative -> Down)
      z - The z coordinate (positive -> North, negative -> South)

  • Method Details

    • add

      public BlockPos add​(Vector3i a)
      Adds the provided vector to the position of the block and returns a new BlockPos with the calculated position values.
      Overrides:
      add in class Vector3i
      Parameters:
      a - The vector that is to be added to the position of the BlockPos.
      Returns:
      A new BlockPos which position is the sum of the old BlockPos and the added vector.

    • add

      public BlockPos add​(int x, int y, int z)
      Adds the provided x, y and z values to the position of the block and returns a new BlockPos with the calculated position values.
      Parameters:
      x - The added x value (positive -> West, negative -> East)
      y - The added y value (positive -> Up, negative -> Down)
      z - The added z value (positive -> North, negative -> South)
      Returns:
      A new BlockPos which position is the sum of the old BlockPos and the added values.

    • west

      public BlockPos west()
      Creates a BlockPos which is directly adjacent to the original block in the west direction
      Returns:
      A new BlockPos one block west to the original BlockPos

    • west

      public BlockPos west​(int n)
      Creates a BlockPos which is positioned west of the original block by the specified number of blocks.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of blocks to move the new BlockPos westward.
      Returns:
      A new BlockPos that is n blocks westward of the original BlockPos

      public BlockPos offset​(Direction dir)
      Creates a BlockPos which is directly adjacent to the original block offset in the specified direction
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A new BlockPos one block offset to the original BlockPos.

    • offset

      public BlockPos offset​(Direction dir, int n)
      Creates a BlockPos which is offset from the original block in the specified direction by the specified number of blocks.
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction in which to offset the position.
      n - The number of blocks to offset the new BlockPos.
      Returns:
      A new BlockPos block offset from the original BlockPos.
